title: Spiral Roadrunner config file schema version 2
description: Spiral Roadrunner config file schema version 2.

on_init.description: Execute command or script before RR starts allocating workers

command.description: Command to execute. It can be script or binary

env.description: Environment variables for the worker processes

command.description: Worker starting command, with any required arguments

user.description: User name (not UID) for the worker processes. An empty value means to use the RR process user

group.description: Group name (not GID) for the worker processes. An empty value means to use the RR process user

env.description: Environment variables for the worker processes

relay.description: Worker relay can be: 'pipes', TCP (eg.: tcp://127.0.0.1:6002), or socket (eg.: unix:///var/run/rr.sock)

relay_timeout.description: Timeout for relay connection establishing (only for socket and TCP port relay)

channels.description: You can configure each plugin log messages individually

cache_size.description: Sticky cache size. Sticky workflow execution is the affinity between workflow tasks of a specific workflow execution to a specific worker. The benefit of sticky execution is that the workflow does not have to reconstruct state by replaying history from the beginning. The cache is shared between workers running within same process. This must be called before any worker is started. If not called, the default size of 10K (which may change) will be used

namespace.description: Namespace name for this client to work with

driver.description: Driver which should be used for the storage

address.description: Host and port to listen on

max_request_size.description: Maximal incoming request size in megabytes. Zero means no limit

middleware.description: Middleware for the http plugin, order is important

trusted_subnets.description: Allow incoming requests only from the following subnets

app_name.description: Application name. NEW_RELIC_APP_NAME env variable should be set if the app_name key is empty.

licence_key.description: Licence key. NEW_RELIC_LICENSE_KEY env variable should be set if the license_key key is empty.

dir.description: Directory for file uploads. Empty value means to use $TEMP based on your OS

forbid.description: Deny files with the following extensions to upload

allow.description: Allow files with the following extensions to upload

request.description: Automatically add headers to every request passed to PHP

response.description: Automatically add headers to every response

dir.description: Path to the directory with static assets

forbid.description: File extensions that should not be served

allow.description: File extensions which should be served

calculate_etag.description: Turn on etag computation for the static file

weak.description: Use a weak generator (/W), it uses only filename to generate a CRC32 sum

response.description: Custom headers for the static files

address.description: Host and port to listen on

certs_dir.description: Directory to use as a certificate/pk, account info storage

email.description: User email, used to create LE account

alt_http_port.description: Alternate port for the http challenge. Challenge traffic should be redirected to this port if overridden.

alt_tlsalpn_port.description: Alternate port for the tls-alpn-01 challenge. Challenge traffic should be redirected to this port if overridden.

use_production_endpoint.description: Use production or staging endpoint. NOTE, try to use staging endpoint to make sure, that everything works correctly.

domains.description: List of your domains to obtain certificates

redirect.description: Automatic redirect from http to https schema

key.description: Path to the cert key file

root_ca.description: Path to the root certificate authority file

address.description: FastCGI connection DSN. Supported TCP and Unix sockets. An empty value disables this

h2c.description: HTTP/2 over non-encrypted TCP connection using H2C

redis.description: Redis section. Should be defined to use as a broadcast driver for the websockets (with no limitation to use in other plugins).

broker.description: Broker to use. Brokers can be set in the broadcast plugin. For example, if you use broker: default here, broadcast plugin should have default broker in its config.

allowed_origin.description: Allowed request origin (single value). This option is optional (allowed all by default)

path.description: http path where to handle websockets connections

broadcast.description: Broadcast plugin. It main purpose is to broadcast published messages via all brokers. Use it in conjunction with the websockets, memory and redis plugins. LIMITATION: DO NOT use the same redis connection within different sections or messages will be duplicated. There is no limitation to use different redis connections (ie localhost:6379, localhost:6378, etc) in different sections.

driver.description: Driver to use. Available drivers: redis, memory. In-memory driver does not require any configuration.

collect.description: Application-specific metrics (published using an RPC connection to the server)

status.description: Health check endpoint (docs: https://roadrunner.dev/docs/beep-beep-health). If response code is 200 - it means at least one worker ready to serve requests. 500 - there are no workers ready to service requests.

address.description: Host and port to listen on (eg.: `127.0.0.1:2114`). Use the following URL: http://127.0.0.1:2114/health?plugin=http. Multiple plugins must be separated using & - http://127.0.0.1:2114/health?plugin=http&plugin=rpc where http and rpc are active (connected) plugins.

unavailable_status_code.description: Response status code if a requested plugin not ready to handle requests. Valid for both /health and /ready endpoints

reload.description: Automatically detect PHP file changes and reload connected services

services.description: List of included for sync services (this is a map, where key name is a plugin name)

dirs.description: Directories to sync. If recursive is set to true, recursive sync will be applied only to the directories in 'dirs' section. Dot (.) means 'current working directory'

recursive.description: Recursive search for file patterns to add

patterns.description: Service specific file pattens to sync

addr.description: AMQP Uri to connect to the rabbitmq server https://www.rabbitmq.com/uri-spec.html

num_pollers.description: Number of threads which will try to obtain the job from the priority queue. Default is the number of the logical CPU cores

pipeline_size.description: Size of the internal priority queue, if the internal PQ reach the max number of elements, the Push operation will be blocked

consume.description: list of pipelines to be consumed by the server automatically at the start, keep empty if you want to start consuming manually

pipelines.description: List of broker pipelines associated with the drivers. This option is not required since you can declare pipelines in the runtime. Pipeline driver should exist.

priority.description: Pipeline priority. If the job pushed to the pipeline has priority set to 0, it will inherit the pipeline's priority

prefetch.description: Number of job to prefetch from the driver

exclusive.description: Declare a queue exclusive at the exchange

multiple_ack.description: When multiple is true, this delivery and all prior unacknowledged deliveries on the same channel will be acknowledged. This is useful for batch processing of deliveries

requeue_on_fail.description: Use rabbitmq mechanism to requeue the job on fail

priority.description: Pipeline priority. If the job pushed to the pipeline has priority set to 0, it will inherit the pipeline's priority

prefetch.description: Number of job to prefetch from the driver

priority.description: Pipeline priority. If the job pushed to the pipeline has priority set to 0, it will inherit the pipeline's priority

prefetch.description: Number of job to prefetch from the driver

reserve_timeout.description: If no job is available before this timeout has passed, Reserve returns a ConnError recording ErrTimeout

priority.description: Pipeline priority. If the job pushed to the pipeline has priority set to 0, it will inherit the pipeline's priority

prefetch.description: Number of job to prefetch from the driver

visibility_timeout.description: The duration (in seconds) for which the call waits for a message to arrive in the queue before returning. If a message is available, the call returns sooner than WaitTimeSeconds. If no messages are available and the wait time expires, the call returns successfully with an empty list of messages.

wait_time_seconds.description: The duration (in seconds) for which the call waits for a message to arrive in the queue before returning. If a message is available, the call returns sooner than WaitTimeSeconds. If no messages are available and the wait time expires, the call returns successfully with an empty list of messages

priority.description: Pipeline priority. If the job pushed to the pipeline has priority set to 0, it will inherit the pipeline's priority

prefetch.description: Number of job to prefetch from the driver

deliver_new.description: The consumer will only start receiving messages that were created after the consumer was created

delete_stream_on_stop.description: Delete the stream when after pipeline was stopped

delete_after_ack.description: Delete message from the stream after successful acknowledge

tcp.description: Plugin to handle RAW TCP packets, available since RR 2.6.0

proto.description: Proto file to use, multiply files supported [SINCE 2.6]

max_connection_idle.description: MaxConnectionIdle is a duration for the amount of time after which an idle connection would be closed by sending a GoAway. Idleness duration is defined since the most recent time the number of outstanding RPCs became zero or the connection establishment

max_connection_age.description: MaxConnectionAge is a duration for the maximum amount of time a connection may exist before it will be closed by sending a GoAway. A random jitter of +/-10% will be added to MaxConnectionAge to spread out connection storms

max_connection_age_grace.description: MaxConnectionAgeGrace is an additive period after MaxConnectionAge after which the connection will be forcibly closed

max_concurrent_streams.description: MaxConnectionAgeGrace is an additive period after MaxConnectionAge after which the connection will be forcibly closed

ping_time.description: After a duration of this time if the server doesn't see any activity it pings the client to see if the transport is still alive. If set below 1s, a minimum value of 1s will be used instead

timeout.description: After having pinged for keepalive check, the server waits for a duration of Timeout and if no activity is seen even after that the connection is closed

fileserver.description: [SINCE 2.6] File server to serve static files

compress.description: When set to true, the server tries minimizing CPU usage by caching compressed files

cache_duration.description: Expiration duration for inactive file handlers. Units: seconds. Use negative number to disable

max_age.description: The value for the Cache-Control HTTP-header. Units: seconds

permission.description: Access permission for the DB file.

interval.description: TTL keys check interval in seconds. It's safe to use 1 second here, but can be a little costly to performance
TTL keys check interval in seconds. It's safe to use 1 second here, but can be a little costly to performance

command.description: Command to execute. Can be any command here which can be executed.

process_num.description: Number of copies (processes) to start per command

remain_after_exit.description: Remain process after exit. In other words, restart process after exit with any exit code

restart_sec.description: Number of seconds to wait before process restart

debug.description: Pool debug mode. Worker will be created right before RR passes request to it

num_workers.description: How many worker processes will be started. Zero (or nothing) means the number of logical CPUs

max_jobs.description: Maximal count of worker executions. Zero (or nothing) means no limit

allocate_timeout.description: Timeout for worker allocation. Zero means no limit

destroy_timeout.description: Timeout for worker destroying before process killing. Zero means no limit

supervisor.description: Supervisor is used to control http workers

watch_tick.description: How often to check the state of the workers

ttl.description: Maximum time worker is allowed to live (soft limit). Zero means no limit

idle_ttl.description: How long worker can spend in IDLE mode after first using (soft limit). Zero means no limit

max_worker_memory.description: Maximal worker memory usage in megabytes (soft limit). Zero means no limit

exec_ttl.description: Maximal job lifetime (hard limit). Zero means no limit

delimiter.description: Data packets delimiter. Every send should end either with EOF or with the delimiter

read_buf_size.description: Chunks that RR uses to read the data. In MB. If you expect big payloads on a TCP server, to reduce `read` syscalls, would be a good practice to use a fairly big enough buffer

anyOf.description: Duration as a string. Valid time units are 'ns', 'us' (or 's'), 'ms', 's', 'm', 'h'

HostAndPortWithTCP.description: Host and port with tcp:// prefix
